{"step_by_step_thinking": "The presence of a flattened nose and left-sided clubfoot in the smaller newborn suggests a congenital anomaly. The difference in hematocrit levels between the two newborns indicates that they have separate circulations. The fact that the mother had no prenatal care suggests that she may not have been aware of a multiple pregnancy. Given these findings, the most likely scenario is that the twins are dizygotic (fraternal) and therefore dichorionic-diamniotic.", "answer_choice": "B"}
